titlestmt.titleproper: Alexander Gordon Walsh papers, Inclusive: 1912-1920, undated, Bulk: 1916-1919

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Alexander Gordon Walsh papers contain memoirs and photographs from the First World War.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Alexander Gordon Walsh was born to John and Jane Walsh of the United Kingdom in Mumbai, India, on 1897 November 30. During his time in the Texas National Guard, Walsh went on active duty on the Mexican border as part of a campaign to limit Pancho Villa's raids into United States territory. He was a part of Company K, 1st Battalion, 2nd Texas Regular Infantry. Upon the outbreak of World War I, the 2nd Texas Infantry combined with a regiment from Oklahoma and some from New Mexico to form the 36th Infantry Division. As a part of the 36th, Walsh fought in France, staying there through May of 1919, when he was sent back to the United States. Walsh died on 1989 February 5 at the age of 91. He is buried in Waco Memorial Park in Waco, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Alexander Gordon Walsh papers contains materials from the early twentieth century. The papers consist of a memoir by Robert W. Sawyer and photographs. The collection does not contain any original materials, only copies. The photographs are mostly from army training in South Texas, but there are some portraits, personal photographs, and a few from France.
Series I, Writings, contains a memoir. Series II, Photographic Materials, contains photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection previously resided in one folder.
For the current round of processing, the materials have been grouped into two series: I. Writings, II. Photographic Materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alexander Gordon Walsh papers, Accession #3694, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Brijin Hartrick. Released on 2020-03-31.

bioghist.p: The series contains a memoir from Robert W. Sawyer. The series is in excellent condition.
